snippet: American officials said Ahmed Abu Khattala has not incriminated himself in the killing of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens and three others, but he has provided interrogators with “key facts” about what occurred on the day of the attacks.
abstract: Justice Department reports that Ahmed Abu Khattala, suspect in 2012 Benghazi consulate attack, has provided American interrogators with statements that corroborate important facts about the incident, though he has not incriminated himself in the killing of Ambassador J Christopher Stevens and three others.
lead_paragraph: American officials said Ahmed Abu Khattala has not incriminated himself in the killing of Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens and three others, but he has provided interrogators with “key facts” about what occurred on the day of the attacks.

headline.main: Benghazi Suspect Said to Corroborate Important Details of Attacks
headline.print_headline: Benghazi Suspect Said to Corroborate Important Details of Attacks
